185956897.review:
Summary

Great RTS, with no forced micro and fast matches

a long match in this game is 1h:30m most matches last about 30min

maps are well designed and everything feels fluid, fun and logical. 

great multiplayer scene :-) 

well worth the price, make sure to get the DLC bundle its well worth the extra coin.

AND amazing mods!





Long edit

WHAT A GAME!

So Im not a 40K fan, never played another game of theirs and only found out its originally a board game like last year. 
On top of that im not even much of a RTS player. like I love them, im just not very good at them. 

But as a guy who's mostly played city builders (emperor:the middle kingdom, ReignFall), RPG RTS's like warband and standard RTS's like Age of empires and the completely under-ratted Cassocks; this game blew my mind.

Firstly, worker units build new structures and fix them or tanks. Thats it. 
By end game one can pretty much forget they exist, and its so liberating. no micro-ing farms that keep dying mid battle or having to make sure your constantly building more. Three is all one needs, one at base, one on each side of your push and off you go.

there are only 3 resources to manage, power, capture (requisition) and a faction specific one for special actions. 
and they are perfectly balanced. that is to say, they all generate automatically from structures or points on the map and they drive game play, not slow it down.

The resources in this game add to the game play, thats the main thing. 
you dont have enough wood = wait for more wood or put some more peasants on it.

Don't have enough requisition? 
there's no time to wait, march into hostile lands and battle to claim it or die! 

Energy is a building set up at base that goes down quick, attacking this can destroy a players eco. 
capture (requisition points?) is gained from points on the map, pushing players into combat with each other, this points can also be buffed into strong points and allow the player to build near them, capturing and defending the right ones at the right times can be the make or break of a battle.
the faction resource changes the way a player plays with these factions which is super satisfying.

These rules are so simple that factions can exist that subvert the rules without breaking the game or the players brain.

Then there's unit spam, my most hated part of most RTS's i've played is build a blob, send it in, then have a million buildings mass producing replacements and win with spam assault.
With this game upgrading a unit cots more than building it. But a fully upgraded unit will destroy two of the same units who are not upgraded (maybe more).
So having a bunch of the same building to quickly replace units helps, but keeping a unit alive long enough to max out wins. 

The game is just jam packed with element of great design like this.

heck, i've had really good matches with my friends that ended within 10 minutes, so obviously we played again.

185517223.review:
- toxic, indiffirent and closed to newcomers community
- no moderation thus a lot of stupid agressive teens (especially from Russia)
- wrong stats 


(Multiplayer) Even if you are a wh40k fan and have been playing since you were a kid, players will not be happy with you. You will be silently kicked 50% of the time just because you have 0 in your stats, and these stats seem not to be updated at all. And such a small and even more ignorant and arrogant community will eventually destroy this game. Here are some Russian-speaking teenagers with stupid nicknames and writing squares. You can only play if you create a game session yourself, but that takes time, or if you play solo (which is not long). Too bad about the game, I do not recommend it because of the rotten and indifferent community.

(Мультиплеер) Даже если вы поклонник wh40k и играли в это с пеленок, игроки не будут вам рады. Вас будут кикать в 50 % случаев молча только потому, что у вас в статах 0, и эти статы походу не обновляются вовсе. И так маленькое, еще и пофигистичное высокомерное коммюнити игроков окончательно уничтожит эту игру. Русскоязычные тут сидят какие-то подростки с дебильными никнеймами и пишут квадратиками. Можно играть только создавая игровой сеанс самим, но это все требует времени, либо играя в соло (что ненадолго). Жаль игру, не советую из-за прогнившего и равнодушного коммюнити

184011733.review:
Dawn of war is a very "aggressive" rts game, its extremly active, battles are dynamic and have some pretty cool unique features of its own. Every army is completly unique from any other and they are all very well balanced.
Every game, even versus bots (if you play on an adapted difficulty to your level of course) will be a unique experience, as you can and have to adapt your strategy depending on your oponents own strategy.
The game have a full 3d camera, which for its time was kinda new and allows you to see the battles upclose and feel the violence of warhammer 40k like you should.

Soulstorm is the last extansion of dawn of war 1, so the one with the most content and rebalance changes and so, the most active multiplayer.
The addition of flight units is pretty nice even thought they are useless in most cases (in my opinion only the tau and orks are worth it). I don't really like playing the darks eldars and sisters of battle but they're a nice addition, they look cool and like all armies, are balanced and unique.

I really love this game and can only recommend it.
Sometimes i get bad experiences, especially online with random peoples that just rush you straight away, i don't really like rushing but its a strategy like another i guess.
